articles.content:
Military attaches corps visits Korean Revolution Museum
    Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- The military attaches corps here visited the Korean Revolution Museum on Friday on the occasion of the 67th anniversary of the foundation of the heroic Korean People's Army (KPA). After the visit, Vu Dinh Thang, military attach of the Vietnamese embassy, who is doyen of the military attaches corps, said that the KPA founded by the great leader  Kim Il Sung has always won victory in the struggle against foreign aggressors.   They wished that the KPA would make greater success in the future struggle under the wise leadership of the respected Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il.  Military attach of the Iranian embassy Mohammad Hassan Nami said that the KPA has firmly defended the freedom and happiness of the country and the people in the struggle against imperialism.

articles.content:
Hwang Son sentenced to imprisonment
   Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- The South Korean authorities have reportedly sentenced Hwang Son to 2 years of imprisonment and 2 years of disqualification on April 22 on charges of "praise, inspiration, meeting and communication" banned by the "National Security Law."    Hwang Son visited Pyongyang last year to take part in the joint expedition to historic relics in the north, a seminar and the August 15 events for reunification in the capacity of a delegate of the South Korean Federation of University Student Councils.   This suppression reveals anti-reunification and fascist nature of the South Korean present "government."

articles.content:
Reception given on 53rd anniv. of Syrian Independence
   Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- Charge d'affaires ad interim of the Syrian Arab Republic Bassam al-Haj Hussein to Korea hosted a  reception at Okryu Restaurant on Friday on the occasion of the 53rd anniversary of the Syrian Independence.  Present on invitation were vice-president Yang Hyong Sop of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun and officials concerned and diplomatic envoys and military attaches of various countries in Korea.   Officials of the Syrian embassy and the Syrian friendship delegation of Army and Armed Forces were present there.   Speeches were made at the  reception.

Film show marks constitution day of Yugoslavia
    Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- A film show was held at the Chollima House of Culture on April 23 under the sponsorship of the Korea-Yugoslavia Friendship Association to commemorate the constitution day of the Federal Republic of Yugoslavia.   Invited there were Djukic Ljubomir, Yugoslav ambassador to the DPRK, and embassy officials.   Present there were vice-chairman Ri Song Ho of the Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign  Countries  who is chairman of the Korea-Yugoslavia Friendship Association, officials of the association and working people in the city.   The participants appreciated the Yugoslav feature film "Assault Teammates."

Floral basket and letters to Kim Jong Il
   Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a floral basket and a congratulatory letter from the diplomatic corps and a congratulatory letter from the military attache's corps here on the occasion of the 67th anniversary of the foundation of the heroic Korean People's Army. The Palestinian Ambassador E.P. Shaher Mohammed Abdlah, doyen of the diplomatic corps, handed the floral basket and the letter to Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun on Friday. Vu Dinh Thang, military attach of the Vietnamese embassy who is doyen of the military attaches corps,  handed the letter to Minister of the People's Armed forces Kim Il Chol on the same day.And congratulatory letters, bouquets and gifts to Kim Jong Il from military attaches of the Vietnamese, Iranian, Russian  and Egyptian embassies and the military attach of the Peruvian embassy  were handed to an official concerned.

articles.content:
Center of DPRK Red Cross Society  opened
   Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- The center for measures against disaster of the DPRK Red Cross Society was opened with due ceremony  here on Friday. It has been built with the  assistance of the International Federation of Red Cross Society and Red Crescent Society .   The center  has made it possible for the DPRK Red Cross Society to  cope with possible natural disasters in time and offer effective assistance and upgrade the creation of human and material resources to a higher level, including the training of officials  involved in this work.   
Present at the opening ceremony were Jang Jae On, chairman of the central committee of the DPRK Red Cross Society, vice-Minister of Public Health Choe Chang Sik and officials concerned.   Also on hand were foreign diplomatic envoys and resident representatives of international organizations in Korea and members of the delegation for assistance from the International Red Cross Society and Red Crescent Society.
   An opening address and congratulatory speeches were made at the ceremony, followed by the cutting of red cloth to inaugurate the center.   The participants looked round offices and facilities of the center.   There was a cocktail party in that connection on the same day.

articles.title: "Great Man's Footprints" published in China
articles.content:
Floral basket laid before Kim Il Sung's Portrait
   Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- Guinean Prime Minister Lamine Sidime sent floral basket to be placed before the Portrait of the President  Kim Il Sung to mark Sun's Day.   The floral basket was laid before the President's Portrait hung in the Korean embassy in guinea by the secretary general and the chief of protocol of the Prime Minister's office, authorized by the Prime Minister on April 15.

articles.title: Korean armed forces are invincible
articles.content:
"Great Man's Footprints" published in China
   Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- A book "Great Man's Footprints" was published by an Institute of Korean Minority in China to mark Sun's Day.The book was written by a Chinese writer Sung Yingshang.
It has a preface and carries more than one hundred anecdotes on the greatness and noble virtues of the President  Kim Il Sung, including "oath made before fatherland," "art of shortening distances," "boiled-rice mixed with other cereals," "on the first line," "Zhou Enlai's statue" and  "good things given first to the people."
   In the book the author cites facts to recount the immortal achievements of the President who devoted his life to the happiness of the people and victory of socialism, his rare wisdom and will which were instrumental in his emerging ever-victorious, matchless grit, broad magnanimity and noble virtues and efforts made to provide and upgrade historic roots of Korea-China friendship.

articles.content:
Greetings to Tanzanian President
   Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of greetings to Tanzanian President Benjamin William Mkapa on Friday on the occasion of the 35th anniversary of the foundation of the United Republic of Tanzania.   The message expressed the belief that the good friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the future in the idea of independence, peace and friendship and sincerely wished the Tanzanian President and government greater successes in their efforts to consolidate the stability and unity, achieve prosperity and improve the standard of people's living.
